WRITING.TITLE: Foodiesphere: Sriracha Peanut Sauce Chicken

WRITING.TEXT: good ideas all, but I like my peanut sauce thick so it works for me
all good ideas, thx for sharing them with me. I'm still a noob when it comes to cooking so a lot of my stuff is trial error.

WRITING.TITLE: Sriracha Peanut Chicken
WRITING.TEXT:
[Sriracha Peanut Chicken](https://train_subject1405.wordpress.com/2015/05/04/foodisphere-sriracha-peanut-sauce-chicken/)
Peanut sauce was relatively easy to do consisting of only three ingredients: 1 cup Natural Peanut Butter 1 tablespoon sriracha Quarter cup coconut oil Add all three into a pan, stir on low for about fifteen minutes or until smooth. Set aside.
Sriracha Peanut Chicken
Ingredients: 1 cup of natural peanut butter 1-2 teaspoons of red curry paste quarter cup of coconut oil 1 tablespoon sriracha (or to taste) 1 pound of chicken breast tenders/chicken breast cut into cubes
Directions: Heat your pan on low. Add coconut oil and red curry paste and stir until mixed. Add peanut butter in stages and stir. You might want to increase the heat slightly (depending on your stove) but I wouldnt go much over the low setting which should be enough to make the sauce creamy. Once smooth and creamy, add the chicken cubes. Stir the chicken in the sauce to make sure its as covered as possible. Cover the pan and let the chicken cook. Check on it occasionally and stir so that the sauce doesnt burn to the pan. I also added about a half cup of water once the sauce started to thicken around the chicken just to keep it relatively smooth rather than gloppy.
Cook for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve on rice with the peanut sauce.

WRITING.TITLE: "Avengers: Age of Ultron" Review
Sriracha Peanut Chicken
WRITING.TEXT:
[Sriracha Peanut Chicken](https://train_subject1405.wordpress.com/2015/05/04/foodisphere-sriracha-peanut-sauce-chicken/)
Peanut sauce was relatively easy to do consisting of only three ingredients: 1 cup Natural Peanut Butter 1 tablespoon sriracha Quarter cup coconut oil Add all three into a pan, stir on low for about fifteen minutes or until smooth. Set aside.
Sriracha Peanut Chicken
Ingredients: 1 cup of natural peanut butter 1-2 teaspoons of red curry paste quarter cup of coconut oil 1 tablespoon sriracha (or to taste) 1 pound of chicken breast tenders/chicken breast cut into cubes
Directions: Heat your pan on low. Add coconut oil and red curry paste and stir until mixed. Add peanut butter in stages and stir. You might want to increase the heat slightly (depending on your stove) but I wouldnt go much over the low setting which should be enough to make the sauce creamy. Once smooth and creamy, add the chicken cubes. Stir the chicken in the sauce to make sure its as covered as possible. Cover the pan and let the chicken cook. Check on it occasionally and stir so that the sauce doesnt burn to the pan. I also added about a half cup of water once the sauce started to thicken around the chicken just to keep it relatively smooth rather than gloppy.
Cook for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve on rice with the peanut sauce.

WRITING.TEXT: To you your first point, I agree. Asking the questions was less about quality and more about just how am I (if I am) crafting an inclusive work. To your second point, you're right. When I originally thought of the story I wanted to have my 'hero' be trans but then I realized I wasn't knowledgeable enough to write a convincing character. Still hoping to in the future.

WRITING.TITLE: What's a good way to find a cover artist?
WRITING.TEXT: So it seems that folks hate my book covers. Whatever. I get it. I don't agree, but I get it. But I don't think I make enough to afford a real artist to create a cover. Does anyone have any suggestions about how to find or query artists?
